title: Provincial Court Family Law Act Protection Order

elements.name: ExistingOrdersFLM
elements.title: Are there any existing written agreements or court `orders` about parenting arrangements, `child support`, contact with a child, guardianship of a child and/or spousal support?
elements.description: A written agreement includes a separation agreement or mediation agreement. A court order may be from any court in any place, including the Supreme Court.

elements.name: existingOrdersListFLM
elements.title: Please select which family law matter issue your existing written agreement or court order is about:
choices: Parenting Arrangements including `parental responsibilities` and `parenting time`

elements.name: otherPartyAttach
elements.title: Did the other party attach a copy of all existing written agreements or court orders about parenting arrangements, child support, contact with a child, guardianship of a child and/or spousal support to their application?
elements.description: If a current agreement or order was missed, you can include a copy with your reply. Check the documents you were served to see if a copy was included already.

elements.name: attachCopyOfExistingOrders
elements.title: You will need to include a copy of your written agreement(s) or court order(s) when you file your documents. You will be reminded to include a copy at the end of the service.

elements.name: existingPOOrdersAttached
elements.title: Did the other party attach a copy of all existing court orders, agreements or plans protecting one of the parties, or the child(ren), or restraining contact between the parties, including a protection order, an order, agreement or plan involving child protection services, or a peace bond, restraining order, bail condition or other criminal order, to their application?
elements.description:
This includes:
  • any family law protection order from Provincial Court, BC Supreme Court, or another jurisdiction
  • any order, agreement or plan involving child protection services including a Protective Intervention Order or Supervision Order under the Child, Family and Community Service Act.
  • any criminal order or conditions protecting a party or restraining/restricting contact between the parties
  • any peace bonds
  • any other order the court may need to know about that restricts or restrains contact, or protects one party and/or a child from another party
If an order, agreement, or plan was missed, select “NO” and you can include a copy with your reply. Check the documents you were served to see if a copy was included already.

If there is no order, agreement, or plan protecting one of the parties, or the child(ren), select “YES”.

elements.name: attachCopyOfExistingPOOrders
elements.title: You will need to include a copy of the missed order(s), agreement(s) or plan(s) when you file your documents. You will be reminded to include a copy at the end of the service.

elements.name: likeToAddCulturalExplanation
elements.title: Do you have any information you would like to share with court about the cultural, linguistic, religious and spiritual upbringing and heritage of your family, including, if a child is an Indigenous child, the child’s Indigenous identity?
elements.description: There is no requirement to share but sometimes there is information you may choose to share with the court to help them in considering the application.
